column1: They made pies; they dug holes
column2: and filled them with water for wells; they made mountains with caves in their sides
column3: and every thing else they could think of. When dinner-time came
column4: Jamie had to be coaxed away from his sand-heap; and mamma said she believed he would sleep in it
column5: if he were allowed to.After dinner
column6: as soon as he waked from his nap
column7: he went straight to his sand again. Freddy was there before him; and soon Minnie Rich
column8: a little girl eleven years old
column10: and played with them.She knew how to work sand better than any of them. First she wet it. Then she made a house with holes in the sides for doors and windows
column11: and a chip for a chimney. Then she made a smooth lawn in front of the house
column12: and some hills and valleys in the rear
